summary: Robert W. Genzman was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay during the specified periods. The consistent appearance of his name across multiple payroll certifications indicates his continued employment with the committee during that time.
significance: Robert W. Genzman's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, which investigated the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his role within the committee, his presence on payroll records confirms his involvement in the investigation, albeit in an unspecified capacity.
